sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_NAME: U.S. Commercial Service Meetings at NAFSA 2024
sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_BESCHREIBUNG:
The U.S. Commercial Service’s Global Education Team is offering onsite matchmaking at NAFSA 2024 from May 28 to May 31 in New Orleans, LA:

  • For overseas agents, counselors, and university partners, you have the opportunity to schedule meetings with U.S. Study State Consortia from 12 States. 
  • For U.S. Education Institutions and Study State Consortia, you have the opportunity to schedule one-on-one meetings with the U.S. Commercial Service (CS) representatives from several overseas markets.  These CS Education Specialists are able to advise U.S. institutions on market selection, education policy, landscape, and understanding foreign students' preferences.

All the meetings will take place at the USA: A Study Destination Pavilion (Booth P1301).
sample_rows.PRIMARY_VENUE_STREET: New Orleans Ernest N. Morial Convention Center

sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_NAME: Canadian Emergency Preparedness and Climate Adaptation Convention (CEPCA) 2024
sample_rows.RELEVANT_INDUSTRIES:
[
  "Fire Safety and Rescue Equipment",
  "Public Safety",
  "Safety and Protection",
  "Safety and Security",
  "Security and Safety Equipment"
]
sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_BESCHREIBUNG:
CEPCA – Canadian Emergency Preparedness and Climate Adaptation was established as a national event to bring together communities, stakeholders, and individuals responsible for managing, responding to, and planning for emergencies and natural disasters across Canada. For the 2024 convention, the key focus is on how Canada can better connect isolated supply chains, community strategies, policies, and access to current information amidst our vast geography and diverse threats.
At CEPCA, we recognize the importance of fostering collaboration and breaking down silos in both emergency management and climate adaptation to enhance public safety. This event is not only an opportunity for buyers to explore innovative solutions but also a platform for exhibitors to showcase cutting-edge products and services. By bringing together leaders and innovators from across the country, we aim to address today’s pressing issues while preparing for tomorrow’s challenges. Join us in Ottawa from September 24–26, 2024, to contribute to a more unified and coordinated approach to emergency response by connecting municipal, provincial, and federal stakeholders—all under one roof.
To register as an exhibitor or attendee, please visit: https://www.emergencyexpo.com/register/

sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_NAME: Cyber Opportunities in the Middle East
sample_rows.RELEVANT_INDUSTRIES:
[
  "Computer Systems",
  "Cybersecurity",
  "Information Services",
  "Information Technology Services",
  "Information and Communications Technology",
  "Security Services",
  "Security Technology",
  "Software"
]
sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_BESCHREIBUNG:
Join the U.S. Commercial Service for a webinar detailing the cybersecurity sectors in four Middle Eastern markets. Hear from cybersecurity experts about everything from regional trends to country specific regulations to market entry strategies. 

Register now to learn about opportunities for U.S. cybersecurity companies in Bahrain, Jordan, Kuwait and Qatar! 

Discussion Topics:
Working with the public and private sectors, what are the local business customs? Which sectors are looking to increase their cybersecurity (Critical Infrastructure, Healthcare, Finance, Oil & Gas, etc.)?
Have there been any major cyber-attacks in the market?
What are the local cybersecurity industry events?
And much more....

Agenda:
11:00am: Introductions & Opening Remarks 
11:05am: Bahrain Market Overview 
11:15am: Jordan Market Overview
11:25am: Kuwait Market Overview
11:35am Qatar Market Overview 
11:45pm Q&A

Speakers:
Imane Alalaiwat, Commercial Specialist, U.S. Embassy Manama 
Lubna Abdelhadi, Commercial Specialist, U.S. Embassy Amman
Rasha Al-Muhtaseb, Commercial Specialist, U.S Embassy Kuwait City
Juan Catril, Commercial Advisor, U.S. Embassy Doha

Logistics:
Cost: $25
Location: Virtual 
Time: May 15th, 2024 at 11:00amEST/8:00am PT

sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_BESCHREIBUNG:
SelectUSA Mexico Conference 

The SelectUSA Mexico Conference is set to become a must-attend event for U.S. economic developers seeking to attract Mexican investments.

The SelectUSA Mexico Conference will enable U.S. state, local, and regional economic development organizations (EDOs) to directly showcase their offerings to qualified Mexican investors and prospects. Conversely, it equips Mexican investors and startups with the essential information and contacts necessary for expansion and success in the United States.

Our Mexico Conference will include a third day dedicated to SelectUSA Tech. We will provide targeted training sessions for selected tech industry startups, concluding with pitching competitions.

Spaces are limited, so don't miss out - secure your spot now, as they will be awarded on a first-come, first-served basis. Register today to seize this incredible opportunity!

  "Aviation",

  "Design and Construction Services",
  "Electricity Infrastructure",
  "Energy",
  "Franchising",
  "Hotel and Restaurant Equipment",
  "Information and Communications Technology",
  "Marine Technology",

  "Medical Devices",
  "Ports Infrastructure and Services",
  "Safety and Security",
  "Tourist Attractions",
  "Waste Management and Recycling"
]
sample_rows.HANDelsEREIGNIS_BESCHREIBUNG:
The United States Department of Commerce, International Trade Administration (ITA), is organizing a Global Diversity Export Initiative (GDEI) Trade Mission to the Caribbean region on November 17-22, 2024, that will include the “Opportunities for Minority-Led Businesses in the Caribbean Region Conference” in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic on November 17-18, 2024. 

ITA is seeking to improve outreach and representation of businesses with owners and/or leaders from underserved communities. This mission is focused on expanding export opportunities to U.S. small and medium-sized businesses that are founded, led, operated or owned by minorities from industries with growing potential in the Caribbean region.
Participants will engage in one-one-one meetings with key service providers and U.S. diplomats and/or industry specialists from 9 countries.

Selected participants will either engage in business-to-business (B2B) meetings in Santo Domingo if approved for the Dominican Trade Mission, or travel to other markets in the region to engage in B2B appointments in those markets. B2B meetings will be conducted with pre-screened potential buyers, agents, distributors or joint-venture partners, in the selected city/market in the Dominican Republic, and/or Barbados/Eastern Caribbean, and/or Guyana, and/or Jamaica, and/or Suriname, and/or The Bahamas and/or Trinidad and Tobago.

The mission is horizontal, with various sectors represented, based on best prospects for U.S. companies in the Caribbean region, such as automotive parts and services, consumer goods, construction equipment/road building machinery/building products/infrastructure projects, medical equipment and pharmaceuticals, ICT, energy equipment and services, safety and security equipment, hotel and restaurant equipment, franchising, manufacturing equipment, yachting/maritime services/sailing equipment, marine ports, aviation/airports, tourism and related construction, waste management, and water treatment and supply.

description: JSON-Details des tertiären Veranstaltungsortes für die Handelsveranstaltung (sofern anwendbar).
URL zum Anzeigen der Details der Handelsveranstaltung.
Branchen, die für die Handelsveranstaltung relevant sind.
Art der Registrierung, die für die Handelsveranstaltung erforderlich ist (z. B. `Registration`, "Application").
Eindeutiger geografischer Identifikator für den Staat, der mit dem primären Veranstaltungsort der Handelsveranstaltung verbunden ist.
Straße des Handelsveranstaltungsortes, der der primäre Veranstaltungsort ist.
Eindeutiger Identifikator für eine Handelsveranstaltung, der von der International Trade Administration (ITA) bereitgestellt wird.
URL zum Anmelden für die Handelsveranstaltung.
Name des Handelsveranstaltungsortes, der der primäre Veranstaltungsort ist.
Stadt des primären Veranstaltungsortes für die Handelsveranstaltung.
JSON-Details des sekundären Veranstaltungsortes für die Handelsveranstaltung (sofern anwendbar).
Liste der Kontaktstellen, die mit der Handelsveranstaltung verbunden sind.
Eindeutiger geografischer Identifikator für das Land, das mit dem primären Veranstaltungsort der Handelsveranstaltung verbunden ist.
